item.title: Hard Quiz: Will you get lucky and ace this quiz? I wouldn't bet on it
item.description: I applaud your courage for having a go. That's about it, though.

item.title: Elena Rybakina defeats Aryna Sabalenka to win WTA Finals and collect record prize money
item.description: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

item.title: Zohran Mamdani gave these New York women 'a glimmer of hope'. They helped make him mayor
item.description: Zohran Mamdani's victory in Tuesday's New York City mayoral election looked unlikely at one point. Polling shows it was women who helped power him into office.

item.title: Die My Love filmmaker Lynne Ramsay on realising a punk rock adaptation of Ariana Harwicz's novel
item.description: After reading Die My Love in book club, Martin Scorsese knew it had to be made into a film. Now it's rewriting cinema's portrayal of womanhood and postpartum depression.

item.title: Students, teaching staff face challenges amid Adelaide University merger
item.description: From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. But as the clock ticks, some students and staff are feeling the pressure.

item.title: Australia Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters says rugby league Ashes needs to continue after defeating England 30-8 in third Test
item.description: Australia coach Kevin Walters has dismissed suggestions the Kangaroos' whitewash series win over England was "a walk in the park", praising his counterparts following the third Test.

item.title: UN photographer Martine Perret turns lens on women of Australia's hinterland
item.description: Parisian-born UN photographer Martine Perret turns her lens to capture the resilience and strength of women in rural Australia.

item.title: Bisalloy Steel defends '20-plus-year' relationship with Israeli companies
item.description: Bisalloy Steel's Unanderra site has been the target of multiple pro-Palestine pickets, and has defended its trade with "several Israeli" companies during its 2025 annual general meeting.

item.title: Bragg says ditching net zero 'too silly for words' as Liberals play semantics
item.description: Ahead of meetings to agree on a Liberal climate policy, the leading moderate says his party must retain a focus on achieving net zero better than Labor.

item.title: Boyne Island boy Nayte Scott diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy
item.description: When Skye Scott took her son to a paediatrician, she never imagined he would be diagnosed with the life-changing Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

item.title: New food safety rules for produce in Tasmania have smaller growers worried
item.description: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.

item.title: Women's pain inquiry finds Victorians' suffering worsened by male-centred healthcare system
item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.title: Princess Anne attends service at Hall of Remembrance in Sydney
item.description: Royal loyalists celebrate the Princess Royal's visit to Australia amid the scandal engulfing her brother, Andrew Mountbatten Windsor.

item.title: Spearmint milk and Hawaiian packs included in celebration of WA's food history
item.description: An exhibition exploring Western Australia's food history in all its guises, including its fast-food pioneers, is on show at the State Library.

item.title: Wallabies lament poor performance in 26-19 Test rugby loss to Italy
item.description: Wallabies captain Harry Wilson says he is "hurting" after Australia's 26-19 loss to Italy, while coach Joe Schmidt is lamenting his side's "flat performance".

item.title: Bragg pledges to do ‘right thing’ if Liberal party scraps net zero commitment
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Oasis leaves Australia after triumphant sold-out tour, with no signs of brotherly discord
item.description: Playing to a combined audience of about 320,000 people, Liam and Noel Gallagher's return to Australia for this much-hyped tour has been nothing short of a triumph.

item.title: The J Awards has been loud and proud about Australian music for 20 years
item.description: The centrepiece of triple j's Ausmusic Month celebrations, the J Awards is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025. Here's how it all began.

item.title: International students are struggling with Australia's cost of living — and experts say there is no quick fix
item.description: International students are grappling with Australia's high cost of living, and experts warn there are no quick fixes to their financial stress.

item.title: Police investigate reports of gunshot heard near Dezi Freeman's property
item.description: Police are investigating witness reports of a single gunshot heard near Dezi Freeman's property shortly after he allegedly killed two police officers in August.

item.title: Kangaroo activity increasing on South Australian regional roads, with collisions up by about 40 per cent
item.description: Drivers on regional roads are being warned of an increase in kangaroo activity on South Australian roads, with large mobs of roos seen lining roads at dawn and dusk, creating growing safety concerns for road users.

item.title: Annemarie Manders reflects on 35 years as a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley
item.description: Annemarie Manders reflects on how she became a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley.

item.title: Grampians hosts Oceania's only World Trail Majors race as ultra-runners ascend Gariwerd
item.description: Nepali runner Sangé Sherpa returns to the Grampians with an unconventional race tactic and a global field of competitors chasing him.

item.title: Labor Party members vote for fracking ban to be extended across all parts of WA
item.description: Labor party members call for hydraulic fracturing, or fracking, to be banned across the whole of WA.

item.title: Firefighters battle out-of-control blaze in New Zealand national park
item.description: Fire and Emergency New Zealand says an out-of-control wildfire in Tongariro National Park has swelled in size to about 1,000 hectares, leading to the evacuation of dozens of hikers.

item.title: The telltale signs the Louvre heist was not a 'professional' job
item.description: A series of missteps shows the theft in the Louvre was far from a sleek operation. Instead, French authorities believe petty criminals executed it.

item.title: Man in custody after 'catastrophic' crash that killed his partner and stepdaughter
item.description: A man in police custody since a crash killed a woman, 30, and a girl, 10, in the Queensland community of Doomadgee has been confirmed as the partner of the woman and father and stepfather of the children in the vehicle.

item.title: Feelings of failure and being unseen. What it's like to be a stepmum
item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Australia beats New Zealand 40-8 to defend Women's Pacific Cup crown
item.description: Julia Robinson scores twice as Australia defeats New Zealand 40-8 to claim a second consecutive Pacific Cup in emphatic fashion.

item.title: Cook Islands qualify for Rugby League World Cup, beating South Africa 58-6 in Sydney
item.description: Cook Islands book their spot in a fourth Rugby League World Cup, turning it on to beat South Africa 58-6 in Sydney.

item.title: Police should have broken up neo-Nazi stunt, NSW opposition says
item.description: NSW Police should have gone to court to stop a neo-Nazi stunt outside Parliament House, Opposition Leader Mark Speakman says.

item.title: Canberra police watch house closed again after sewage 'spewed out all over the place'
item.description: The police union calls for Canberra's city watch house to be condemned and a new one built after faulty sewerage forced the site to be temporarily closed.

item.title: Majority of Australia's first Ashes Test squad to feature in Sheffield Shield round four
item.description: Fourteen members of Australia's 15-man squad for the first Ashes Test will take part in this week's Sheffield Shield fixtures, while England will play an intra-squad game in Perth.

item.title: Salt-N-Pepa, White Stripes inducted into Rock & Roll Hall of Fame
item.description: A star-studded line-up including Elton John, Chappell Roan, Stevie Wonder and Cyndi Lauper performs at LA's Peacock Theatre for a ceremony to induct Salt-N-Pepa, Warren Zevon, Sound Garden, Outkast, Bad Company and the White Stripes into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.

item.title: New Zealand defeats Samoa 36-14 to claim Pacific Cup and farewell Kieran Foran in style
item.description: New Zealand overturns an eight-point half-time deficit to defeat Samoa 36-14 and claim its second Pacific Cup.

item.title: Why the Pacific Championship final should be a look into rugby league's future
item.description: New Zealand stopped Samoa from making history in the Pacific Championship final but the match was a tantalising reminder of what's possible for rugby league in the days to come.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.title: Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin's remains return to Israel
item.description: Hamas hands over Hadar Goldin's remains as part of its ceasefire agreement with Israel.

item.title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong makes landfall in the Philippines
item.description: The massive storm has already killed four people and forced more than a million people to evacuate from flood and landslide-prone areas.

item.title: Alex de Minaur defeated in ATP Finals by Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(5), 6-2
item.description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz began his bid for a first ATP Finals trophy with a 7-6(5), 6-2 win over Australian Alex de Minaur in their round-robin clash at the season-ending championships in Turin on Sunday.

item.title: Americans face food cuts and flight delays in record US government shutdown
item.description: Unpaid federal workers are turning to food banks and draining their savings as the longest US government shutdown in history drags on.

item.title: Tassal suffers fish kill at barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay amid expansion plans
item.description: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand.

item.title: Victoria's Wurundjeri people file native title claim for Melbourne
item.description: The Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung people in Victoria have filed a native title claim with the Federal Court, seeking recognition over country that spans much of Melbourne.

item.title: Crime rise at Melbourne shopping centres sparks calls for action
item.description: Crime has increased at several major Melbourne shopping centres with concerned communities calling for more action.

item.title: Renewable energy 'spilled' as generation outgrows demand
item.description: Mountains of clean power are regularly "wasted" as Australia's energy system evolves. But a large amount of battery storage is waiting in the wings, ready to soak it up.

item.title: Liberal decision on net zero unlikely to resolve bitter internal divide
item.description: As Liberals descend on Canberra to settle a climate policy, conservatives and moderates remain opposed on the question of net zero, threatening a deeper rupture.

item.title: Replacing Sussan Ley as Liberal leader isn't an easy fix to the party's problems
item.description: As the federal Liberal Party embarks on more self-harm over climate change policy this week, the idea seems to have set in among some that tearing down its first ever female leader could be a low-consequence affair.

item.title: Are Australia and its rare earths part of the solution to 'magnet shock'?
item.description: Anyone who controls the supply of magnets controls the future, and China has been quietly working on this under America's nose for decades. Can Australia muscle in?

item.title: Time running out for Australia to win the rights to host COP31 in Adelaide
item.description: It is almost crunch time for Australia to secure hosting rights for the next COP meeting, so it is timely to examine why the government's bid is languishing and how it can resolve a long-running stand-off with Türkiye.

item.title: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to return 'Yellow Peril' home
item.description: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to take the city's controversial "Yellow Peril" sculpture.

item.title: Top BBC bosses resign over edit of Donald Trump documentary
item.description: Britain's public broadcaster has been criticised for editing a speech Mr Trump delivered on January 6, 2021, before protesters attacked the US Capitol in Washington.

item.title: Beyond the Box showcases Australian artists using cardboard to create art
item.description: Artists have been using cardboard for at least a century to create works. These Australians showcase how the humble medium can be transformed into striking sculptures and collage.

item.title: Dozens missing in Malaysia after boat carrying migrants sinks
item.description: The boat was carrying about 100 migrants, including Rohingya Muslims fleeing conflict, hunger and ethnic violence in Myanmar.

item.title: Ashleigh Gardner stars for Sydney Sixes with 5-15 in big WBBL win over Perth Scorchers
item.description: Melbourne Renegades repeat last season's WBBL final win over Brisbane Heat while the Sixers crush Perth by 10 wickets at the WACA.

item.title: Split Enz announce reunion with details for 2026 tour
item.description: It's been 50 years since Split Enz's debut album. Now they're getting the band back together for a string of arena dates in next year.

item.title: AFL gives teams finishing 10th chance to win premiership through wildcard round in finals
item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.title: Federal politics: Albanese picks former Labor premier for top diplomatic role in UK — as it happened
item.description: Anthony Albanese announces the next high commissioner to the United Kingdom, a former South Australian premier. Look back at our coverage today.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Wallabies 'not looking for excuses' after defeat to Italy
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says his weary charges must toughen up rather than seek excuses after falling to Italy in Udine, ahead of two more severe tests to come.

item.title: Mildura Base Public Hospital caught duplicating feedback figures in annual reports
item.description: A Victorian hospital has been caught copying and pasting its compliments and concerns data, after failing to update figures across multiple years of its annual reports.

item.title: Cable car on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington included in draft recommendations, Right to Information documents show
item.description: The Tasmanian government has made a draft recommendation for a cable car on Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington, documents released under Right to Information laws show.

item.title: Exhibition depicting Geraldton homelessness shown at Canberra's Parliament House
item.description: A portrait exhibition of people who have experienced homelessness is opening up conversations to show everyone has a story worth listening to.

item.title: Why Oscar Piastri was handed a 10-second penalty during the F1 São Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

item.title: More than 2,800 US flights cancelled in a day as government shutdown persists
item.description: More than 2,800 domestic flights are cancelled in the United States over the course of a single day due to an ongoing shortage of air traffic controllers.

item.title: Eastern ground parrot found in Narawntapu National Park, Tasmania
item.description: The presence of an endangered and "cryptic" parrot species at a northern Tasmanian national park is hailed as "very good news" by a bird expert.

item.title: RBA warns economy in danger of being trapped in slow growth lane indefinitely
item.description: The central bank's deputy governor says it's "more plausible" to wonder whether rates can go much further than to forecast further cuts. He says unless Australia's economic capacity lifts, the economy will struggle to grow without generating inflation.

item.title: Princess Anne remembers Porepunkah police officers in wreath-laying ceremony in Melbourne
item.description: The Princess Royal attended a ceremony at the Police Memorial in Melbourne as part of her official visit to Australia.

item.title: French 'Fedora man' pictured at Louvre heist scene unmasked as teenager
item.description: A 15-year-old is unmasked as the "Fedora man" in a viral image taken outside the Louvre on the day of the crown jewels heist.

item.title: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics
item.description: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

item.title: Connor Mathiasson jailed for culpable driving after Elise Hodder killed outside rave in Kooyong
item.description: A grieving father whose daughter was killed in a "catastrophic" crash says more needs to be done to deter young men from behaving dangerously behind the wheel.

item.title: US Senate votes in favour of bill to end federal government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

item.title: Emergency department waits of 35 hours for some SA mental health patients, AMA warns
item.description: About 10 per cent of mental health patients in South Australian hospital emergency departments are being kept waiting "more than 35 hours" for a bed, the AMA says.

item.title: Donald Trump booed at NFL game between Washington Commanders and Detroit Lions
item.description: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

item.title: Richmond set to host 'home' AFL fixture in Tasmania for the first time in club's history
item.description: Richmond will run out for a home game in Tasmania for the first time in its history next season in a decision the club says it has not taken lightly.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: Youngest town in WA's Kimberley faces life without a cemetery
item.description: From a floating coffin to a bed of rock, time is running out for Kununurra's cemetery.

item.title: Ian Leavers, former Queensland police union boss, found dead at Brisbane home
item.description: The state's first cross-border commissioner was found dead at his home on Monday morning. Police say his death is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: Bradley Wayne Wilkinson jailed for 16 years over road rage manslaughter of Rhyce Harding
item.description: A driver has been handed a 16-year jail sentence after he "used his vehicle as a weapon" to cause the tragic death of Rhyce Harding in Sydney's west.

item.title: Father of seven-year-old neglect victim denied bail while awaiting sentencing
item.description: A man whose young son died after his pneumonia was left untreated is refused bail ahead of his sentencing for criminal neglect, with a judge noting his history of being "persistently non-compliant" while on supervised bail. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the name of a person who has died.

item.title: Social media attack on Sydney MPs who condemned Neo-Nazi rally reported to police
item.description: The federal Member for Wentworth and the NSW Member for Vaucluse posted to social media denouncing the antisemitic rally by Neo-Nazis in Sydney, and offensive messages they received in response have been flagged with police.

item.title: On the Myanmar-Thailand border, bombing a scam centre could barely dent the industry
item.description: Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

item.title: Logan man Umar Al Enizi cleared of murder after Browns Plains road rage incident in 2021
item.description: A man accused of intentionally running down another man during a road rage incident in 2021 has been cleared of murder by a jury in the Supreme Court in Brisbane.

item.title: South Korea's former president accused of provoking military conflict with North Korea
item.description: Yoon Suk Yeol attempted to provoke military conflict between South and North Korea in order to declare martial law, a prosecutor's spokesperson tells a briefing.

item.title: Lions are 'unrelenting' and yet again the underdogs for this finals series
item.description: The Brisbane Lions secured a spot in their sixth consecutive preliminary with a win over Melbourne on the weekend. Yet with North Melbourne's dominance, the Queenslanders are "underdogs" in the race for the flag once again.

item.title: Cairns woman Toyah Cordingley killed on beach after 'confrontation' with former nurse, court told
item.description: Toyah Cordingley was "doing something that she would always do", exercising along a secluded Far North Queensland beach when she was violently killed seven years ago, a court in Cairns has been told.

item.title: Family and police appeal for information linked to Brandon Yates's fatal stabbing
item.description: Police launch a public appeal to help find the killer of 28-year-old man who died from stab wounds in Wollongong's main street.

item.title: Canberra man given three-year sentence for sexual offences against 11-year-old girl
item.description: Canberra man Shegu Bobb has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court for a series of sexual offences against an 11-year-old girl, after a jury found him guilty earlier this year.

item.title: Police arrest two teenage boys after machete incident in Alice Springs shopping centre
item.description: Northern Territory police have arrested two teenage boys following reports of a person armed with a machete at the Yeperenye Shopping Centre in Alice Springs on Monday.

item.title: Redress scheme opens for 3,000 Stolen Generations survivors in WA
item.description: Survivors of the Stolen Generations in Western Australia can now apply for $85,000 in compensation as part of a government redress scheme.

item.title: Homicide detectives speak to two adults following death of one-year-old boy in Ballarat
item.description: Detectives from the homicide squad have spoken to two adults following the death of a one-year-old boy in regional Victoria.

item.title: Cameron Green to test reworked bowling action in Sheffield Shield clash ahead of Ashes
item.description: Australia is hopeful that a slight adjustment to Cameron Green's bowling action allows the star all-rounder to have a big say in this summer's Ashes campaign and beyond.

item.title: Thinking about an e-bike or e-scooter for your kid? Here's what's legal and safe
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: Woman and child drown in Dandenong Creek in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: Police believe a woman went to the aid of a child drowning in the creek, before also getting into difficulty on Monday afternoon.

item.title: A leaked memo brought down two senior BBC bosses — here's what it said
item.description: A leaked memo to the BBC's editorial standards board has dominated headlines in Britain and led to the resignations of two board members. Here's a look at what has happened and how the bosses responded.

item.title: Who is Jay Weatherill, Australia's new high commissioner to the UK?
item.description: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Cudlee Creek bushfire class action trial begins in SA's Supreme Court
item.description: Victims of the devastating 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, which caused more than $200 million in damage, are seeking compensation from SA Power Networks, alleging the electricity distributor was negligent in the lead-up to the blaze.

item.title: Family of murdered backpacker Simone Strobel still seeking answers 20 years after death
item.description: The family of German backpacker Simone Strobel says a second inquest into her death has failed to bring them answers about how and why she died on holiday in NSW 20 years ago.

item.title: Nampijinpa Price pulls out of Put Australia First rally appearance with far-right activist Tommy Robinson
item.description: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price was due to speak at the Put Australia First event later this month alongside Tommy Robinson, a one-time member of a fascist political party.

item.title: Monday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mitchell Starc fires Ashes warning in Sheffield Shield return as Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to fire
item.description: Mitchell Starc enjoys a successful return to red ball cricket while representing New South Wales but Jake Weatherald and Beau Webster fail to grab their opportunities.

item.title: Push for a ban on using ‘doulas’ during childbirth
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: NSW Police say a "communication error" led to Neo-Nazi protest being authorised by police
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: CCTV footage of a youth wielding a machete at the Yeperenye Shopping Centre in Alice Springs.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Donald Trump pardons Rudy Giuliani and others involved in trying to overturn 2020 election
item.description: The US president has pardoned his former lawyer Rudy Giuliani and others who were involved in trying to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy released from prison pending appeal
item.description: Sarkozy became the first former French president to be sent to prison in modern times, this September.

item.title: Thailand suspends peace deal with Cambodia after landmine blast near border
item.description: The peace deal between the two countries was overseen by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Eight dead and many injured after car explosion near Delhi's historic Red Fort
item.description: Police say the explosion came from a car stopped at a red light outside the city's 17th Century Red Fort area.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5b over 'salacious' documentary
item.description: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

item.title: Early childhood professors release six-point plan to fix 'broken' childcare system
item.description: Some of Australia's leading early childhood education professors join forces to release a six-point action plan to help fix the country's "broken" childcare system.

item.title: A damning memo shows the BBC's issues are bigger than its coverage of Donald Trump
item.description: It is not US President Donald Trump who represents the biggest political threat to the BBC, but a leaked 8,000-word letter of complaint to the broadcaster's board motivated by "despair at inaction".

item.title: The faces with a front-row seat to history
item.description: After Gough Whitlam was sacked, a crowd formed. They could have stormed the building. Fifty years on, this photo tells the story of The Dismissal.

item.title: Why Australia's ironclad future is under threat
item.description: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

item.title: Crime rates are down in Moree, but police admit they cannot 'arrest their way out' of youth crime problem
item.description: Youth crime rates have fallen in the rural NSW town of Moree but tensions within the community remain high after a string of violent incidents.

item.title: COP30 kicks off 10 years on from the Paris Agreement. Where is the world at?
item.description: It was a moment of euphoria when the world came together to sign a pact on climate action. Ten years on from the 2015 Paris Agreement we managed to shift the needle. But the problem is it's just not happening fast enough.

item.title: DV prevention advocate Kym Valentine urges action on delayed alcohol laws
item.description: Advocates are concerned changes to alcohol delivery laws, which were a recommendation of South Australia's Royal Commission into Family, Sexual and Domestic Violence, are taking too long.

item.title: US risks AI debt bubble as China faces its 'arithmetic problem', leading analysts warn
item.description: Two leading experts on the world's biggest economies warn both countries face serious challenges, and not just over trade with each other.

item.title: Millennials and Gen Z voters continued shift away from Coalition in 2025
item.description: As Liberals prepare to fly to Canberra to hash out their net zero stance, results from the Australian Election Study suggest those under 45 have continued to drift away from the Coalition.

item.title: Cardiac patient reveals urgent surgery at Sydney public hospital was cancelled four times
item.description: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

item.title: Amazon Flex drivers on battling bots and the culture of fear to keep their jobs
item.description: Tech giant Amazon claims to offer convenience to both its customers and its contractors. This is what the drivers behind your packages want you to know.

item.title: Drug drivers involved in more Queensland road fatalities than drunk drivers
item.description: More than 1,000 positive drug tests involving cocaine have been recorded by Queensland Police since the narcotic became part of the state's roadside testing regime as drug driving overtakes drink driving in fatal crashes.

item.title: Bat colony causes Gympie council to consider property buyback scheme
item.description: A Queensland council will consider seeking government funding for a property buyback scheme as part of a new flying fox management plan.

item.title: Who is the man that wants to 'leave shit behind' as the new ACT opposition leader?
item.description: To be the leader of the Canberra Liberals you need to be thick-skinned, have a lot of persistence, and be very confident — and if Mark Parton's first press conference in the role is anything to go by, he might just be the perfect fit.

item.title: Ferrari boss tells drivers to 'talk less' after Lewis Hamilton's 'nightmare' comment
item.description: Lewis Hamilton says his first season with Ferrari has been "a nightmare" after the team suffers another failure, this time at the Brazilian Grand Prix.

item.title: Federal politics: Greens, Coalition question why Nauruan president's visit was kept secret — as it happened
item.description: The Coalition and the Greens call on the government to explain why the high-level visit with Nauruan President David Adeang was not made public.

item.title: Micro parties on the rise as discontent with major parties grows in regional NSW
item.description: As voters demand better political representation in the bush, two new micro parties in the NSW Riverina region promise to be a solution.

item.title: Stunning icicle kick by David Rodríguez wins Canadian Premier League final
item.description: A blizzard, a sensational overhead kick goal, snowploughs clearing the pitch for extra time — the Canadian Premier League soccer final had it all.

item.title: Owners barred from Beachport holiday units after council fire safety change
item.description: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

item.title: ASX loses ground, CBA posts $2.6b quarterly profit but sheds 6.6pc in value — as it happened
item.description: Commonwealth Bank reported a marginal rise in first-quarter profit, but its share price still lost 6.6 per cent in value, while the ASX200 lost ground.

item.title: Loving mother drowned trying to save six-year-old son in Dandenong Creek, says her family
item.description: A mother of three who drowned in a creek in Melbourne's south-east while trying to save her six-year-old boy has been described as "full of energy and loving" by her family.

item.title: International Olympic Committee appears to move closer to banning transgender women from female sport
item.description: The International Olympic Committee heard from experts from the Protection of the Female Category working group last week, with a decision set to be made on rules around transgender athletes competing at the Olympics.

item.title: NSW Nationals MPs reject net zero emissions target 'in principle'
item.description: On Monday night, the NSW Nationals held a partyroom meeting to discuss their position on net zero following a report into Australia's energy future.

item.title: Hungarian British author David Szalay wins Booker Prize 2025 for his novel Flesh
item.description: Hungarian British author David Szalay bests past winner Kiran Desai and former shortlistee Andrew Miller to win the prestigious Booker Prize for his sixth book, the "extraordinary, singular" Flesh.

item.title: Whitlam Dismissal live from 1975: How it unfolded, 50 years on
item.description: Fifty years ago today, prime minister Gough Whitlam was dismissed by governor-general Sir John Kerr. To mark the anniversary, we're putting you right there as it happened, covering the key moments of that fateful day in 1975 in real time.

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects call to overturn same-sex marriage legalisation
item.description: A former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after a high court's 2015 ruling had been looking to appeal.

item.title: Typhoon Fung-wong leaves eight dead and 1.4 million displaced in Philippines
item.description: The aftermath of a 1,800-kilometre-wide super typhoon has left more than a million people displaced from their homes in the Philippines.

item.title: Prince William opens up about sharing Kate's cancer fight with children
item.description: Prince William has opened up about his and Catherine's "balancing act" in talking to their children about the family's recent health challenges, including the princess and King Charles's cancer diagnoses.

item.title: Bush retreat brings together veterans to talk and lighten their load
item.description: Nestled in the foothills of a mountain, a retreat near Rockhampton in central Queensland brings together veterans, their families and others to talk and lighten their load.

item.title: Influencer fined $830 for lighting fire on World Heritage-listed island K'gari
item.description: The woman lit a prohibited fire on the protected sand island and used a drone in a restricted area.

item.title: Aftermath of car explosion that killed at least eight in Delhi
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What we know about the car explosion near Delhi's historic Red Fort landmark
item.description: Investigators are piecing together what happened after an explosion in a densely populated area of India's capital killed at least eight people.

item.title: Remembrance Day services held across Australia marking 107 years since the end of World War I
item.description: People across Australia have gathered to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

item.title: Three-year-old boy and parents dead after car hit by truck in western Victoria
item.description: A three-year-old boy and his parents have died in a horrific crash near Ballarat. The child's grandmother, the sole survivor of the crash, has been flown to hospital.

item.title: New 'radio map' of the Milky Way reveals where stars are born and die
item.description: The Milky Way appears as a dusty band of stars, but by observing its radio frequencies a different view can be seen, revealing parts of the galaxy hidden from sight.

item.title: Prosecutors drop sexual assault, rape charges against Geelong AFL player Tanner Bruhn
item.description: Lawyers for Geelong AFL player Tanner Bruhn say "false allegations" were made against him and a friend, telling the media the pair have been vindicated in court.

item.title: Charli XCX enlists The Velvet Underground's John Cale for Wuthering Heights collaboration House
item.description: Charli XCX shares an "elegant, brutal" song featuring John Cale, the first for the soundtrack to Emerald Fennell's film adaptation of Wuthering Heights.

item.title: Every WA energy retailer found to have overcharged customers after Synergy's $40m bungle
item.description: Every energy retailer in Western Australia has overcharged customers by taking automatic payments from closed accounts, an investigation by the state's economic regulator reveals.

item.title: Jail for Sydney financial fraudster who scammed families out of $20 million
item.description: More than 150 mum-and-dad investors trusted self-proclaimed property developer Krishnakumar Sitaram Agrawal, only to be caught up in his "dishonest behaviour".

item.title: Wallabies desperate to avoid 67-year low on draining end of season Tour of Europe
item.description: After falling to England and Italy, the Wallabies are halfway towards becoming the first Australian tourists since 1958 to lose four straight Tests in Europe.

item.title: The US government shutdown is one step closer to ending. Here is what happens next
item.description: A US Senate vote to approve funding legislation looks set to break a political stalemate that has sidelined federal workers, delayed food aid and significantly disrupted domestic air travel.

item.title: The Wiggles 'likely breached' consumer law with sale of Emma Bow headbands, watchdog says
item.description: The Wiggles will produce an episode of their parenting podcast, highlighting the product's recall and safety issues relating to button batteries.

item.title: NFL player Alex Singleton has testicular cancer surgery the day after playing key role in Denver Broncos win
item.description: Denver Broncos player Alex Singleton was told he had cancer on Monday, played in the NFL on Thursday and had surgery on Friday.

item.title: Te Maire Martin ready to aid Eli Katoa's recovery, but warns path may not be comparable
item.description: Te Maire Martin knows what it takes to get back on the field after a brain bleed, but warns that Eli Katoa's path is not going to be exactly identical for one reason.

item.title: Witnesses begin giving evidence in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley in Far North Queensland
item.description: Witnesses in the trial of Rajwinder Singh, who is accused of murdering Far North Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley, have begun being questioned as the trial concludes its second day.

item.title: Margaret River surfer survives wrestle with shark at Boat Ramp break
item.description: Margaret River surfer Andy McDonald survives to tell the tale of his encounter with a shark at popular "Bombie" surf break.

item.title: Prices rising fastest in inner cities and growth towns during expanded 5 per cent deposit scheme
item.description: Inner cities, wealthy suburbs and fast-growing regional centres top the list of house price growth in October, according to a new deep dive focused on homes covered by the 5 per cent deposit scheme.

item.title: Donald Trump hosts landmark meeting with Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa in Washington
item.description: Donald Trump praises Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa after a landmark White House meeting — the first time a Syrian president has ever visited Washington.

item.title: A motorised hydrofoiler rides well clear of swimmers off Adelaide's metropolitan coastline
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sport Integrity Australia report reveals athletes' and coaches' views on abuse
item.description: A new report from Sport Integrity Australia asks athletes and coaches about the misbehaviour they may have experienced from community levels to the elite standard.

item.title: Magistrate sentences driver following 'highest alcohol reading' she's ever seen
item.description: A Victorian magistrate praises a man's engagement with counselling services during sentencing after being caught with a blood alcohol reading 10 times over the legal limit.

item.title: Non-bank sector in ASIC, RBA's gaze as customers chasing property loans drift their way
item.description: The tapering of super-sized bank profits has shone a spotlight on the growth of the non-bank sector. Regulators have them in sight given the risk they pose to the financial system.

item.title: Paul Keating on the dismissal of Gough Whitlam as PM
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Alleged gunman charged with murder over 'execution-style killing' of John Versace in Condell Park
item.description: John Versace, 23, died in the driveway of a Sydney property in what police at the time described as "extremely brutal".

item.title: Date set for Alan Jones's court hearing with up to 139 witnesses expected to be involved in Crown's case
item.description: A court hearing date to determine indecent assault charges against the veteran broadcaster has been set, with a Sydney court told up to 139 witnesses may be involved in the Crown's case.

item.title: AI could be the ultimate test of Australia's democracy
item.description: Developing safe AI is not just an opportunity for a democracy like ours; ever since our superpower ally checked out of its responsibilities on this front, it's an obligation.

item.title: Nauruan president makes secretive trip to parliament amid claims bikies won lucrative contract
item.description: Nauru's president has made a secretive visit to Parliament House in Canberra amid allegations that bikie gangs won a lucrative contract to provide security for former immigration detainees.

item.title: Tasmanian parliament to apologise for body parts kept in pathology museum
item.description: The Tasmanian government will apologise for the past practice of retaining body parts after autopsies without the knowledge or consent of family members.

item.title: Melbourne council rejects application for 24-hour McDonald's on popular Northcote strip
item.description: An inner-north Melbourne council votes against an application from the fast food giant, which is seeking to open a 24-hour outlet on a popular shopping strip that was once named the world's coolest street.

item.title: Torres Strait Islanders appeal federal court decision on landmark climate case
item.description: Two Torres Strait Islander uncles are appealing a federal court ruling that the Commonwealth does not owe a duty of care to protect their people from the impacts of climate change.

item.title: Nauru's president makes secretive Parliament House visit
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canada loses its measles-free status after ongoing outbreaks
item.description: Canada has lost its measles elimination status due to ongoing outbreaks as childhood vaccination rates fall and the highly contagious virus spreads across North and South America.

item.title: I thought I hated basketball. Now it's given me an amazing life
item.description: After breaking her back at 19 Katherine's community made sure she knew how special she was. Wheelchair basketball brought her back to earth and made her life "truly amazing".

item.title: 'No legislative fix' for rise of neo-Nazis, counter-extremism expert warns
item.description: Professor of Global Islamic Politics at Deakin University Greg Barton says while elements of public expressions of Nazism should be banned, there is no "quick fix".

item.title: Trio arrested in regional SA for alleged scam targeting innocent motorists
item.description: Three people have been arrested in relation to an alleged scam targeting motorists along the state's Eyre Peninsula.

item.title: Rex Airlines saved as creditors vote for Air T takeover
item.description: US-based Air T will become the new owner of Regional Express Holdings (Rex) after creditors voted in favour of a deal to keep the airline's regional operations in the air.

item.title: Two commercial flights narrowly missed work site on shortened Melbourne Airport runway in 2023
item.description: A Melbourne airport runway that had been shortened by more than a kilometre led to two close calls involving commercial flights in September 2023.

item.title: Donald Trump pardons multiple lawyers, aides for their role in 2020 'fake electors' scheme
item.description: Lawyers, campaign aides and a former publicist for Kanye West — here's who Donald Trump has pardoned for allegedly trying to overturn the 2020 election.

item.title: Princess Anne lands in Brisbane
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Princess Anne visits Gallipoli Barracks in Brisbane on Remembrance Day as Australian tour ends
item.description: The Princess Royal is on a four-day tour of Australia, culminating in a visit to Queensland where she has laid a wreath and watched a tug of war.

item.title: Nauru's president departs Parliament House after brief meeting
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Grounds revealed for State of Western Australia's appeal against abuse survivor Dion Barber's $2.8 million payout
item.description: The State of Western Australia is appealing the entire basis of a judgement which awarded a Perth man nearly $3 million in compensation for abuse he suffered while he was in state care.

item.title: England cricket great Ian Botham concerned by lack of warm-up matches prior to first Ashes Test
item.description: England's only warm-up game prior to the first Ashes Test will be an internal match, a fact that is greatly concerning legendary all-rounder Ian Botham.

item.title: Dozens of patients caught up in medical scan bungle at Caboolture Hospital as review ends
item.description: A major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital's outpatient clinic finds 38 patients did not get follow-up care, prompting the health service to apologise again for the bungle.

item.title: Former Darwin real estate agent denied bail after allegedly running over foot of BMW repossession agent
item.description: A Darwin real estate agent accused of running over the foot of a BMW car repossession agent has been refused bail in the Darwin Local Court.

item.title: WWII veterans pass legacy onto next generation at Remembrance Day in Perth
item.description: As the number of veterans who served in World War II dwindles, George Franklin and Russell Hosken try to keep the memory alive for future generations.

item.title: West Australian man Patrick Joseph Hunter stands trial over alleged rape of girl under 10
item.description: Patrick Joseph Hunter, 46, is facing a charge of sexual penetration of a child under 13 and four counts of indecent dealing with a child under 13.

item.title: Childcare centre and supervisors charged after toddler's death outside Darwin
item.description: The Northern Territory government has confirmed a rural Darwin childcare centre and three of its supervisors have been charged after the death of a toddler at the centre in 2023.

item.title: Georgia Wareham's all-round brilliance helps Melbourne Renegades sink Sydney Thunder in WBBL
item.description: Renegades captain Georgia Wareham continues her blistering start to this year's WBBL campaign, scoring a half-century with the bat and picking up two wickets with the ball.

item.title: Where Trump's lawsuits against news outlets stand as he threatens to add BBC to the list
item.description: The BBC could be the next media organisation to be sued by US President Donald Trump. So where do the president's other lawsuits stand?

item.title: Tuesday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Government announces increased police powers around masks, bans on certain items and symbols in protest crackdown
item.description: Stronger police powers tackling masks and face coverings, a ban on attachment devices and bans on certain flags and symbols are part of a suite of government reforms to be taken to parliament on Wednesday.

item.title: Satellite imagery matched to Sudan's El-Fasher shows the brutality of a massacre
item.description: Satellite imagery has shown pools of blood in Sudan’s El-Fasher, after the RSF militia took control. For relatives — finding out who has survived has turned into a torturous task.

item.title: Algal bloom exposes 'limitations' in government monitoring programs, Senate inquiry
item.description: A Senate inquiry into South Australia's toxic algal bloom has been tabled highlighting "limitations" in how the government has handled the crisis.

item.title: Council discovers 46 trees mistakenly cut down during park redevelopment
item.description: The Town of Victoria Park has revealed nearly 50 trees were removed without authorisation during redevelopment works to a park and adjacent hospitality precinct, and says it is investigating what went wrong.

item.title: When can a strip search be conducted?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bombing near Islamabad court kills 12, Pakistani Taliban claims responsibility
item.description: Pakistan's interior minister says a suicide bomber detonated explosives near a police vehicle outside the gate of a district court in Islamabad on Tuesday.

item.title: Car bomb explodes outside district court in Islamabad
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Indian anti-terror agency leading probe into Red Fort car explosion in New Delhi
item.description: Narendra Modi has described the attack that killed at least eight people as a "conspiracy", vowing to bring those responsible to justice.

item.title: Several ancient statues stolen from Syria's national museum
item.description: Officials say at least six marble statues were stolen from the museum in Damascus.
